title: How are uppercase and lowercase numbers used? - Quora

response.answer_text: This goes back hundreds of years, and was used by printers to name the letters they were using; the box containing the “lower case” letters was situated underneath the box containing “upper case” or capital letters.

Lowercase numbers are pretty rare these days. You can see them in the Georgia font and a few others, but almost all fonts use uppercase numbers all the time. Uppercase numbers are all the same height and are monospaced, so they line up better in tables and columns.
